snippet.textDisplay:
I never played Chrono Trigger or Chrono Cross, but over the last several months I've been listening to their soundtracks, they are without a doubt, the best music I've ever heard in my life, not just game music, but the best music period...

I just bought Chrono Trigger on Steam for $7.00
Eager to start playing after work. :)
snippet.textOriginal:

Eager to start playing after work. :)

snippet.textDisplay:
Suitable theme for her, without a doubt the kindest and most tragic person in the game, next to Magus himself whom despite everything he sacrificed and horrific deeds he commited along the way, couldn't save her. The only gift he got was to be called by his birth name for the first and only time as an Adult.

Damn it Squeenix, why didn't you announce a remake!

snippet.textDisplay: @116410692555521347954 Sorry if I overreacted. It's just that I have been listening to this great playlist for the last few weeks and there are a lot of comments that get commented on in this fashion. I just wanted to make the point that it is irrelevant, what game was first. If you know a game (like Kirby) and you listen to this tune for the first time, you feel reminded of it. No need to point out that this isn't completely correct. One of the great things about VGM is how it triggers memories and is seemingly all connected. There was really nothing wrong with your paticular comment, it was just the one that made me wanted to shout out: "stop correcting people in this manner!" :) no offense. (and by the way... I am no native speaker, I am not really sure about the exact connotation of "smartass", I always thought of it as a very moderate term)
snippet.textOriginal: @116410692555521347954 Sorry if I overreacted. It's just that I have been listening to this great playlist for the last few weeks and there are a lot of comments that get commented on in this fashion. I just wanted to make the point that it is irrelevant, what game was first. If you know a game (like Kirby) and you listen to this tune for the first time, you feel reminded of it. No need to point out that this isn't completely correct. One of the great things about VGM is how it triggers memories and is seemingly all connected. There was really nothing wrong with your paticular comment, it was just the one that made me wanted to shout out: "stop correcting people in this manner!" :) no offense. (and by the way... I am no native speaker, I am not really sure about the exact connotation of "smartass", I always thought of it as a very moderate term)

snippet.textDisplay: Actually, some of the Zeal folks managed to survive the fall, so the human race would have continued. Without sacrificing herself to save the party, the rest of them could have taken up where the dead ones left off, assuming Lucca or Robo stayed in the End of Time. Without her pacifistic nature, she could have toasted her crazy mom and saved her people. Then again, I don't blame her because I am like that too; not everyone can be a completely selfless silent protagonist.
snippet.textOriginal: Actually, some of the Zeal folks managed to survive the fall, so the human race would have continued. Without sacrificing herself to save the party, the rest of them could have taken up where the dead ones left off, assuming Lucca or Robo stayed in the End of Time. Without her pacifistic nature, she could have toasted her crazy mom and saved her people. Then again, I don't blame her because I am like that too; not everyone can be a completely selfless silent protagonist.

snippet.textDisplay:
Schala is such a brilliant character. Without her, the entire planet would have died out several times over. Without her compassion for those without magic, the human race would have died out. Without her sacrificing herself to save the party, Lavos would have destroyed the planet. Without her guidance, Magus would have grown up to be a far more dangerous figure.

One of the most underrated characters in any game ever.
snippet.textOriginal:
Schala is such a brilliant character. Without her, the entire planet would have died out several times over. Without her compassion for those without magic, the human race would have died out. Without her sacrificing herself to save the party, Lavos would have destroyed the planet. Without her guidance, Magus would have grown up to be a far more dangerous figure.

One of the most underrated characters in any game ever.

snippet.textDisplay: @Arc13 Actually, I find she is quite integral. Aside from yanking your party's butt out of the bottom of a sinking palace, you never know what happens to her (in the original). She is quite honestly the most compelling character because she is specifically never heard from again and the reason for a whole other character's entire existence within the game. So I would have to say that she is quite compelling.

snippet.textDisplay: @Arc13 Schala is the little girl attached to Lavos in the last fight in Chrono Cross. She has lots to do with many of the events of which occurs in CC. She is the one who created her clone Kid for "Project Kid" and sent her to Serges dimension and is the one calling Serge in the beginning of the game at Oppassa Beach etc. As for her hair color being blonde it is because she has reverted back to her natural hair color, the people of Zeal only died their hair blue to separate themselves from the..
snippet.textOriginal: @Arc13 Schala is the little girl attached to Lavos in the last fight in Chrono Cross. She has lots to do with many of the events of which occurs in CC. She is the one who created her clone Kid for "Project Kid" and sent her to Serges dimension and is the one calling Serge in the beginning of the game at Oppassa Beach etc. As for her hair color being blonde it is because she has reverted back to her natural hair color, the people of Zeal only died their hair blue to separate themselves from the..

snippet.textDisplay: @Reaper679 I've played Cross. I'm speaking in terms of Trigger, since this is Trigger. Plus I'm still not 100% convinced it's Schala in Cross, considering she's aged younger by about 10 years, is blond, lost her clothes but somehow found new more revealing clothes, and doesn't have even remotely the same personality or looks in any way.
snippet.textOriginal: @Reaper679 I've played Cross. I'm speaking in terms of Trigger, since this is Trigger. snippet.textDisplay: I always found it weird that a great theme like this hardly got played at all in the game.  Mitsuda made so many amazing themes, I guess it's inevitable that some would play for less than a single minute in the game (see "Frozen Flame" from Chrono Cross as well).
snippet.textOriginal: I always found it weird that a great theme like this hardly got played at all in the game.  Mitsuda made so many amazing themes, I guess it's inevitable that some would play for less than a single minute in the game (see "Frozen Flame" from Chrono Cross as well).

snippet.textDisplay:
I never had that much sympathy for Schala.  She was pretty much responsible for the world being ruined, because she had no willpower to stand up to the prophet (when he threw the heroes in the portal) and Queen Zeal (by powering the Mammon Machine).

If she had just stood up for what was right, the world would have been saved.
snippet.textOriginal:
I never had that much sympathy for Schala.  She was pretty much responsible for the world being ruined, because she had no willpower to stand up to the prophet (when he threw the heroes in the portal) and Queen Zeal (by powering the Mammon Machine).

If she had just stood up for what was right, the world would have been saved.

snippet.textDisplay: Funny thing is when you replay the game, she doesn't do THAT much for the game and story, mostly just an excuse character for everyone to eternally chase after. So why do we continue to chase after her? Most likely due to still yet her mysterious ways leading her to becoming one of the more interesting characters. On tp of this, you spend half the game with people insulting you and trying to kill you and she's the only one who's nice to you. Lastly, you really want this theme to play more often.
snippet.textOriginal: Funny thing is when you replay the game, she doesn't do THAT much for the game and story, mostly just an excuse character for everyone to eternally chase after. So why do we continue to chase after her? Most likely due to still yet her mysterious ways leading her to becoming one of the more interesting characters. On tp of this, you spend half the game with people insulting you and trying to kill you and she's the only one who's nice to you. Lastly, you really want this theme to play more often.

snippet.textDisplay:
Well this is the first game in the list where I actually had to make sure I hadn't uploaded a particular theme already, there's just so many.

The Kingdom of Zeal was awesome and Schala had her own awesome theme. It has some similarities with Xenogears' Shevat theme. You can definitely tell it's Mitsuda.
